testing.name: The demographic situation of the Ukrainian lands in the late nineteenth - early twentieth century.

question.text: What is the social strata was numerically dominant in the Ukrainian lands in the late nineteenth century.?

answer.text: Cities in the Ukrainian lands in the Russian Empire was in its national composition mainly non-Ukrainian
For the Jewish population of the Russian Empire was determined line of settlement that included all of Ukraine
In the early twentieth century. Dnieper deployed in a massive railway construction
Massive labor migration from Western Ukraine has started because of the abolition of serfdom in these lands

question.text: What city in the Ukrainian lands at the end of the nineteenth century. Was naynaselenishym?
What nations made up the largest minority in the Ukrainian lands?
For which people in the Russian Empire was defined "boundary settlement"?
What is the reasoning correct? In the Russian Empire: 1) all people have equal rights, 2) national composition of population in the Ukrainian lands was motley.
